name: 黃如瑩
objective: 本課程透過希臘英雄的偉大冒險故事以及希伯來聖經傳統中的聖哲事蹟來探索早期西方文明的兩大源頭（希臘與希伯來文化）所呈現出的主要風貌。
schedule:
REQUIRED TEXTS
(1)
Textbook:  The Norton Anthology of Western Literature
Edition: Eighth edition, Volume One
Publisher:  Norton
Publishing year: 2006
(2)
Textbook:  ”Metamorphophoses”
Translator: Mary M. Innes
Selected sections:
Book III: ”Juno and Seleme,” and ” Echo and Narcissus”
Book X: ”Orpheus and His Wife,” ”Pygmalion and Galatea,”
and ”Venus and Adonis”
Publisher:  Penguin
Publishing year: 1955
(3)
Textbook:  ”Mythology:  Timeless Tales of Gods and Heroes”
Author:  Edith Hamilton
Selected sections:”Cupid and Psyche,””Orpheus and Eurydice,” and ”Pygmalion and Galatea”
Publisher:  Warner Books
Publishing year: 1942,1999
(4)
Textbook:  ”Allusions to Western Literary Works”
Chinese title: 西洋文學典故
Author:  Chen-chone Guan (關辰雄 )
Publisher:  The Crane (文鶴)
Publishing year: 1996
(5)
Textbook:  ”It's Greek to me!  Brush up Your Classics”
Chinese title:引經據典說英文
Author:  Michael Macrone
Translator:  Jian-chong Lu ( 呂健忠 譯      )
Publisher:  Bookman ( 書林   )
Publishing year: 1999
**SYLLABUS”
PART ONE:  GREEK EPIC
Week 1--Week 4
PART TWO:  GREEK TRAGEDY
Week 5--Week 8
PART THREE:  THE OLD TESTAMENT
Week 9--Week 11
PART FOUR:  THE NEW TESTAMENT
WEEK 12--WEEK 15
PART FIVE: THE MIDDLE AGES
Week 16
**A drama presentation of six Greek love stories
in the end of semester**
scorePolicy:
1.  Attendance:  Deduction of 5% final grade per absence
2.  Participation in class discussions: 20%
3.  Homework and in-class exercises: 30%
4.  Final project:  Public performance of 6 Greek love stories
(a) Group performance: 40%
(b) Individual performance:  10%
